For everyone who is having problems extracting try this, because yes, i realized the way it was RARed is a bit confusing. (Thanks to Wotter who helped a few with this problem)

1. Select all the rar files

2. Extract to a different folder

3. run the unl-smbr.exe

4. Select where you want the game to extract


as for any other questions

- I do not know if you get the Crab-head

- I would recommend you make a separate Steam account if you decide to play while using steam.

- I dont know much about the THETA release, but apparently it crashes alot.

is it possible to connect the game to steam

k, so I've played some of this, it works, and is really great. I don't find much buggy except in the replays, if you destroy a wall while playing the wall stays up during the replay and it appears as though you are going through walls (no big deal though).
as for getting banned, I don't think you would, but if your paranoid just exit steam before running, problem solved.
those having trouble installing, you need to first highlight ALL of the rars, and extract them...you then extract only one of the rars in the folder that you just extracted from the first bunch of rars. You then should have a folder containing the .exe, install with that, and you should be up and running.
911lol, that should fix your problem (i had the same thing)

to be more specific, 911lol, the reason your getting that message is cause you are trying to extract what is inside the first bunch of .rars by selecting only ONE of them...you have to select them all, and THEN extract.

BxCc, you can put it into your steam library (I don't think there are any risks in doing so, maybe someone can confirm whether there are or not for you, or google it), but that would not make it so that you have things like steam achievements...it would be in there as a non-steam game, so really there's no point, unless you want to have a list of all your games organized in steam.

Hi I did just about everything asked in the instructions but I get this error message "SuperMeatBoy.exe has encountered a problem and needs to close...." I tried adding it as a non-steam game and still did not work. Is there a particular file or software missing maybe?

@boomman Blame the release groups for this archiving system. 

There are 31 zip archives so that its easier to download and in case one of the archives goes bad, it can simply be replaced. Mind you the release groups do not use torrents.

Most of the p2p uploaders first unpack the release they get from newsgroups (and direct-dl sites) before torrenting it. Seems like alexisthebest didnt unpack. 

All in all, stop complaining boomman, at least you get this shit for free. You can easily unpack by selecting all archives -> rt click -> then click "unrar/unzip here" or simply by unziping the first part. 

Thanks alex and Unleashed. Good game.
